div1.p: Blue assigns Carter to investigate malaria in North Carolina.

in July of 1914
Senior Surgeon H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Md.
Sir:
div1.p:
In connection with investigations of malaria begun by
you in North Carolina, you are directed to proceed, on or
about September 15, to Bluett Falls on the PeeDee River,
and such other places within that State as may be necessary.
You will direct the studies being made of impounding waters
in that region, and on instructions from the Bureau, you
are authorized to make such additional trips from Baltimore
to places in North Carolina as may be required to complete
this investigation. The observations made and the data col-
lected will be utilized in submitting a final report on the
subject.

Your status while on this detail will be that of special
temporary duty, and on completion of the duty enjoined, you
will rejoin your station, Baltimore, Maryland.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon-General. J W S
The expenses incurred in carrying out the foregoing
instructions are hereby authorized.
B R Newton
R B Assistant Secretary. ✓
